title: West Rock Super-Prestige Short Track Series
Rad & Gnar VISION QUEST -  Cycling for a Dream
The Seven Lakes Ride
description:
This is a fund raising event to benefit the patients of Eastern Connecticut Cancer Institute (ECCI) in Manchester, CT. Both routes are fully supported and begin in Stafford, CT.   So come out and “Pedal for Patients”!!!

There will be two rest stops on the 20/25 mile ride and several rest stops on the 45/62 mile ride.  Rest stops will be stocked with snacks (water, pbj’s, baked goods, granola bars, m&m’s, etc.) and will have a floor pump and basic repair tools.  The 45 and 62 mile routes will travel through the charming rural towns of Willington, Ashford, Union, and Woodstock then head into the quaint southeastern Massachusetts towns of Sturbridge, Holland, and Wales before returning to Stafford. The 20 and 25 mile routes will traverse the towns of Stafford, Willington, Union, Staffordville, and Stafford.

All routes are fully supported and there will be multiple rest stops stocked with food, drinks and water. In addition, Tolland Bicycle Shop will be providing on-site technical support and the first 100 pre-registered riders are guaranteed a sweet Seven Lakes Ride water bottle. And after the ride, there will be a raffle for some great prizes and lunch will be served.  So come out and “Pedal for Patients” with us — you don’t want to miss it!!

New this year – Seven Lakes Ride Cycling Jersey’s for purchase:

Proceeds from the Seven Lakes Ride Jersey purchases will benefit patients from the John DeQuattro Cancer Center in Manchester, CT. Jersey’s ordered by May 15th will be available on the day of the ride (June 28th) and cost is $75. After May 15th, jersey’s will increase to $85 to cover shipping costs and jersey’s will be mailed to you. Please check the following links for correct sizing as jersey purchases are non-refundable.

title: Wednesday Night CX Clinic
description: Cyclocross clinic open to juniors and adults
course: Grassy fields, double track, and four separate stations that will introduce and help develop proper dismounting/remounting and barriers.
notes:
This is a fundraiser for the CCAP.  This is a USA Cycling sanctioned event and annual or one-day ($15) licenses are required.  NOTE: MOUNTAIN BIKES WITHOUT BAR ENDS ARE OK. BMX BIKES ARE NOT ALLOWED.
HELMETS AND SIGNED RELEASE ARE REQUIRED TO RIDE! JUNIORS MUST HAVE SIGNED RELEASE FROM GUARDIAN
Email Karen Franzen: karen@ctcyclingadvancement.com with any questions.
directions: 91 South: Take exit 24 to Rt. 99 South to 5th light and turn right on Rt. 160 (Elm Street). Follow 160 and turn left at the first light into Elm RIdge Park. Follow driveway to back area by dog park. I91 North: Take exit 23 to West St. Turn right at ext, at 2nd light turn left onto Gilbert Ave and follow to first stop sign. Turn right on Elm St. Follow Elm to first light, turn right into Elm Ridge Park. Follow driveway to back area by dog park.

title: Silk City Cyclocross
description: The 5th annual Silk City Cyclocross is the first stop of the Connecticut Series of CX.  The race has been moved to the west campus for this year.  Expect a similar course to years past, except even better.
course: 2 miles of turny fun with enough technical challenges to keep you focused.
registration:
USA Cycling license required.  One-day licenses can be purchased at registration for $15. : A one-day license can not be used in the Mens or Womens Pro/1/2/3 races.   Day-of registration will be available from 7:30  a.m. until 1/2
 hour before scheduled start time for all fields. A $10 day of registration fee will apply (except juniors).  Additional races only $10.  Promoter reserves the right to cancel or combine fields with less than 10 pre-registered riders.  fields that pay 5 places must have a minimued by my LAm of 20 ro.  Less than 20 will pay 3 places.  Juniors race for FREE:  we'll even pay all the fees including the one-day license if you need one.  You don't have to race a junior field to qualify.  Pre-register here if you want to race another category field and we'll comp you at registration.  Sorry Kids, only one free race.  All national and New England Regional cyclocross Champions -  Free entry: limited to the field that you are the champion of and you must wear your championship jersey in that race.  Second race at at the reduced second race rate.  Pre-register and you will be comp'd at registration.  All USA Cycling rules apply.  Mountain bikes without bar ends are acceptable.  Helmets are required at all times.  Jerseys must have sleeves (no tank tops or vests (unless they're leather). All CT Series of CX rules apply.
*cash prize not to exceed $1999 per category*
notes: Centrally located minutes east of Hartford, Ct.  1.5 hours from Boston, 2 hours from New York City, 2 hours from Albany.
directions: Exit 1 off I-384.  Follow signs to Manchester Community College.  Enter college on Hillstown Road.  Parking is in the West Lot this year.

title: New Haven Urban MTB Race
description: Time trial format with riders competing individually over a 400 foot out and back course consisting of man made obstacles and barriers.
course: 400 foot out and back course with hay bale maze, hay wagon, ramps, tires and skinnies to traverse.
notes: Dirt jump bike or BMX bikes will be the fastest but any mountain bike  within USAC regulation will be acceptable.  No bar end extensions allowed, helmets required.
directions: Googlemap to 1001 Chapel St, New Haven, CT  06510

title: Connecticut Cycling Festival Urban MTB Race
description: Time trial format with riders competing individually over a 400 foot out and back course consisting of man made obstacles and barriers.
course: 400 foot out and back course with hay bale maze, hay wagon, ramps, tires and skinnies to traverse.
notes: Dirt jump bike or BMX bikes will be the fastest but any mountain bike within USAC regulation will be acceptable. No bar end extensions allowed, helmets required.
directions: Start line address: 2225 Trumbull Street, Hartford, CT  06103

title: Ashford Metric Century+
description:
Welcome to our 6th annual Ashford Metric Century+!  

This is a fund raising event to benefit the Ashford Recreation Department and Nerac Earth Cycling Club. All routes are fully supported and include the quiet and rolling hills of Ashford, Eastford and Woodstock.  Come out and enjoy the stunning fall foliage in classic New England. 

Registration starts at 7:00am and ends at 9:30am.  100 miler's should be on the road by 7:30am, 62 milers by 9am and all other riders should be on the road by 9:45am.  Day of ride registration will be an additional $10 for each ride except the 10 miler which will be an additional $5, so $20 for the 10 miler, $30 for the 25 miler, $35 for the 62 miler, and $45 for the 100 miler on the day of the event.  Please register online to save money! 

There will be one rest stop on the 25 mile ride and several rest stops on the 62 mile and 100 mile ride.  Rest stops will be stocked with snacks (gatorade, water, pbj's, baked goods, granola bars, m&m's, etc.) and will have a floor pump and basic repair tools.

Participants should ride with a tube, tire levers, pump, and patch kit in case of flat tires.   CPSC or US DOT approved helmets are required.

We plan on having another fantastic raffle this year.  You can pre-purchase tickets here on bikereg or at the school on the morning of the ride.  Don't forget to check the raffle table after the ride to see if you won!

Please join us after the ride (starting at noon) for free baked potato with all the fixings and apple crisp with vanilla ice cream.  

Date:	Sunday, October 4th 2015
Time:	100 mile 7:30am start
  65 mile 9:00am start
  25 mile 9:30am start
  10 mile 9:30am start

Registration is from 7:00am to 9:30am

Contact: AshfordMetric@charter.net
course:
100 mile 7:30am start
  65 mile 9:00am start
  25 mile 9:30am start
  10 mile 9:30am start
registration: Registration is from 7:00 am to 9:30 am or pre-register online at https://www.bikereg.com/ashford-metric-century
directions:
Ride starts at Ashford Elementary School on Route 89 in Ashford, CT

Ashford Elementary School
440 Westford Rd.
Ashford, CT 06278

From the South and Willimantic:
From Willimantic take Route 195 north toward The University of Connecticut. In Mansfield Center turn right onto Route 89. Follow Route 89 north into Ashford. Cross Route 44. Ashford School is located on Route 89 2 miles north of the intersection with Route 44.

From the West and Hartford:
Take I-84 East to Exit 69. Turn right onto Route 74. Follow Route 74 through Willington to Route 44 in Ashford. Turn left on Route 44 to the intersection of Route 89. Turn left on Route 89. The school is on the right 2 miles to the north.

From the North and Massachusetts:
Take I-84 to Exit 72. Turn left on Route 89. Follow Route 89 (south) watching the signs because it turns twice. Ashford School is located on the left side of Route 89 about 6 miles from I-84.

From the East and Rhode Island:
From the Rhode Island border take Route 101 west. It merges with Route 44 in Pomfret. Continue on Route 44 west until Route 89 in Ashford. Turn right on Route 89. Ashford school is located on the right about 2 miles north of Route 44.
